On-site participants:

  • Laptop with an internet connection is required
  • Should have headphones with mic to collaborate with remote participants if needed.
  • Please think of a suitable socket adapter for your notebooks
Remote participants:
  • The workshop will take place exclusively in Zoom for remote participants. Communication will take place via Zoom Chat.
  • Audio (and video) setup to be able to actively participate.


Technical Requirements:
  •  Participants will need to bring their own laptops to actively engage in the hands-on exercises. The following should be installed in advance:
    • A web browser (Chrome or Firefox recommended).
    • Text editor (e.g., Visual Studio Code, Sublime Text) for code exploration.
    • Access to the internet for web-based tools and exercises.
  • All other necessary tools and instructions will be provided during the workshop.

We wish you a successful workshop and look forward to seeing you!

Best regards,
Conference Team
session.name: Workshop: Beyond Firewalls - DevOps-Ready Application Security with ADR
session.details:
In today’s fast-paced digital world, cyber threats lurk in the shadows, waiting to exploit vulnerabilities in your applications. "Beyond Firewalls: DevOps-Ready Application Security with ADR" is a hands-on workshop designed to help developers, security teams, and IT professionals understand how Application Detection & Response (ADR) can detect, report and block these threats before they cause damage.
Through real-world case studies, live demos, and interactive discussions, you'll learn how ADR works, why traditional security measures fall short, and how to implement proactive defense strategies to keep your applications safe. Join us and take your application security to the next level!Workshop Overview: Beyond Firewalls: DevOps-Ready Application Security with ADR
In today’s fast-paced digital world, cyber threats lurk in the shadows, waiting to exploit vulnerabilities in your applications. "Beyond Firewalls: DevOps-Ready Application Security with ADR" is a hands-on workshop designed to help developers, security teams, and IT professionals understand how Application Detection & Response (ADR) can detect and neutralize these threats before they cause damage.

session.name: Turn Right to Turn Left: Plugging the Application Gap in Detection and Response Capabilities
session.details:
The application layer is the new battleground, yet traditional security tools—WAFs, Firewalls, and EDR—fail to provide deep visibility. This leaves SOC teams blind to how vulnerabilities are exploited in production. Contrast Application Detection and Response (ADR) changes the game by detecting and blocking real-time attacks while notifying developers about underlying vulnerabilities.
In this session, we’ll showcase ADR’s ability to integrate with SIEM tools, automate incident triage, and support compliance frameworks like DORA and NIS2. A technical demo will highlight how ADR enhances SOC operations, reduces workload through autonomous blocking, and feeds critical insights back to development.
Key takeaways:
  • Detection & Response: Gain application-layer visibility and block attacks in real time.
  • Autonomous Protection: Reduce SOC workload and prevent lateral movement.
  • Notify Left: Inform development with real attack data to prioritise fixes.
  • Compliance Readiness: Align with DORA, NIS2, and other frameworks.
Like it or not, your SOC team is already fixing application vulnerabilities—let’s do it right.

session.name: From Static to Strategic: Reimagining Application Security for a DevOps World
session.details:
For 20 years, AppSec has been driven by ego—fixated on scanning, maturity models, security gates, and compliance theater while breaches continue to rise. Security champions? A feel-good distraction. Shift left? Built on bad data. Vulnerability management? Chasing problems that don’t matter.
It’s time to burn it all down. Runtime security is the future—context-rich, built for speed, and focused on stopping real threats instead of producing endless reports.
If you think AppSec is working, this talk will make you uncomfortable. If you know it’s broken, this is your call to arms. Forget compliance. Build security that actually works

session.name: DevOps and Value Stream Thinking: Enabling Flow, Efficiency and Business Value
session.details:
DevOps has transformed IT, but teams need a holistic approach to optimizing software delivery and operations to deliver real business value. Value Stream thinking helps organizations visualize and improve flow, but DevOps practices, automation, and reliability engineering make it actionable.

In this session, Helen will explain how DevOps professionals can apply key DevOps practices—including automation, leadership, and SRE principles—to remove bottlenecks, accelerate flow, and drive measurable impact. Attendees will walk away with a practical roadmap for integrating DevOps capabilities into value stream thinking, drawing on industry best practices and key skill areas covered in DEVOPS INSTITUTE and PeopleCert certifications, including DevOps Foundation, DevOps Leader, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) Foundation, and Value Stream Management (VSM) Foundation

session.name: Build Your Foundation for Actionable AI
session.details:
Agentic AI is revolutionising enterprises, but it can feel overwhelming and with enterprises juggling an average of ~1,000 systems, ensuring AI-driven insights are accurate, connected, and actionable is no small feat.. Discover how to implement a composable architecture providing the essential building blocks to transform your APIs into actionable language for intelligent agents and drive business outcomes. Learn how to future-proof your AI strategy with MuleSoft’s actionability for the multi-agent era.

​

session.name: You Can't Do AI without Quality APIs
session.details:
In today's hyper-accelerated tech landscape, AI is revolutionizing everything it touches—but there's a critical component that's often overlooked: the symbiotic relationship between AI systems and the APIs that power them.We're living in a moment where quality APIs aren't just nice-to-have infrastructure—they're the essential connective tissue that transforms AI from isolated potential to real-world impact. Using fresh industry data and practical examples, we'll explore how the relationship between AI and APIs is evolving at lightning speed, and why organizations with robust API strategies are uniquely positioned to win in the AI era.What You’ll Learn:
- The fundamental shift happening in API design as we move from human-first to machine-first consumption patterns
- The emerging standards that are streamlining AI-API interactions
- Actionable strategies to future-proof your API ecosystem for the intelligent systems of tomorrowWhether you're just starting your AI journey or scaling existing implementations, this session will reframe how you think about your API strategy—not as technical debt but as your organization's most valuable bridge to AI-powered innovation.

session.name: Bringing devops to mobile: Avoiding pitfalls and unlocking velocity
session.details:
DevOps has transformed software delivery, but mobile development presents unique challenges that traditional DevOps models often can't address effectively.
In this session, Kaushal Vyas, Product Manager at Bitrise, will show you how to overcome mobile DevOps antipatterns by identifying key shortfalls in generic CI pipelines. He'll explore the specialized infrastructure needed for effective mobile delivery and how mobile testing and releasing differ fundamentally from web applications. You'll walk away with actionable insights to make informed build-vs-buy decisions and bring DevOps discipline to mobile without friction, delivering better apps faster.


This talk will cover:
  • Why mobile needs a distinct approach to DevOps, why generic CI won’t cut it for mobile, How mobile CI/CD differs — and what that means for your pipelines
    • Infra needs
    • Tooling needs
  • Focussing more on the entire platform - Testing + Releasing
    • Testing: Running UI and end-to-end tests is unique to mobile, where you would use emulators/simulators. Web FE also has challenges, but mobile requires an entirely different setup.
    • Code signing - Installing the app packages on mobile devices requires signing the app package. Managing code signing automatically can be quite painful as it involves generating certificates and provisioning profiles on the go
    • Releasing:
      • App Store/Play Store as gatekeepers. You can’t just release a hotfix to your users. The release must go through the App Store, and users must explicitly update their app version.
      • Review system - The App Store and the Play Store have strict guidelines that app developers have to follow in order to continue distributing their apps via the stores. This means developers have to go through a review process, which delays the process.
  • Common DevOps anti-patterns in mobile environments
  • Strategies to improve reliability, speed, and feedback loops
  • Avoiding the build vs buy traps for mobile
  • Case studies from teams that successfully integrated Mobile DevOps

session.name: Considerations and Impact of AI in Application Security
session.details:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is reshaping application security (AppSec), presenting both opportunities and risks for enterprises. AI is lowering barriers to cybersecurity while simultaneously introducing new threats. We will explore the evolving threat landscape and discuss how easy it is to include vulnerable AI generated code and highlight the importance of a robust AppSec program.

Key Discussion Points:
  • Lowering Barriers to Entry: How AI is democratising both security and cyber threats.
  • Evolving Threat Lifecycle: Understanding how AI-driven threats emerge and how organisations should respond.
  • AI-Powered Attacks: Key risks, including AI poisoning and adversarial manipulation.
This session will provide valuable insights into emerging AI-driven trends in application security.

session.name: AI-Powered Value Stream Reporting: Revolutionizing DevOps Automation and Delivery Efficiency
session.details:
In the rapidly evolving landscape of software development lifecycle (SDLC) automation, including DevOps, DevSecOps, platform engineering, and other transformative practices, it is crucial to measure the value these innovations bring to organizations. Value stream reporting serves as a powerful mechanism to evaluate the effectiveness of automation, enabling teams to identify bottlenecks and areas for improvement.


By leveraging data from diverse DevOps tools, organizations can create dashboards and reporting systems that provide actionable insights into their value stream mapping. These visualizations empower stakeholders to pinpoint inefficiencies, optimize workflows, and enhance the overall value delivered to customers. As the complexity of tools and technologies grows, the ability to centralize and analyze data becomes vital for driving continuous improvement and achieving strategic objectives. Value stream reporting not only fosters transparency but also aligns teams toward a shared goal of delivering high-quality software efficiently and effectively.

session.name: Regaining choice, flexibility and control over your Metrics, Logs and Traces with Cribl
session.details: Collecting, processing and storing telemetry has become expensive, static, and causes a loss of control over your observability approach. Discover how Cribl give your choice, flexibility and control over your observability sessions. This will be illustrated with examples of how companies have used Cribl to route, reduce, and enrich logs, metrics, and traces, resulting in cleaner telemetry data that reduces observability bills while increasing telemetry control.

session.name: Modern Dev Environments: From Static Workstations to Dynamic, AI-Aware Systems
session.details:
Development environments are evolving from static, local setups into dynamic, cloud-based, infrastructure-managed systems. 

In this session, Eric Paulsen (Field CTO, Coder) explores how platform and DevOps teams are rethinking dev environments as scalable, secure infrastructure, provisioned on-demand, policy-driven, and tailored to the needs of modern software delivery.

We’ll also look at where this is heading next: how lightweight AI agents inside environments can support developers by automating tasks like environment setup, compliance checks, and contextual help, without adding friction.

This session offers practical patterns and observations from the field, with a focus on enabling developer productivity without compromising control or security.

specialDays.name: Mastering Kubernetes Camp
specialDays.details:
This compact two-day workshop is designed to provide you with an in-depth understanding of Kubernetes. You will start with fundamental concepts and then progress to advanced topics such as volumes, ConfigMaps, Secrets, init-containers, Deployments, and persistence.
Through hands-on labs, you will gain practical experience in deploying and managing applications in a Kubernetes cluster.
By the end of the workshop, you will have a solid grasp of Kubernetes architecture and operations. This will enable you to deploy, access, and manage applications efficiently.
You will be well-prepared to work with both cloud-based and on-premises Kubernetes solutions and engage in informed discussions about Kubernetes-based architectures with your peers.
This workshop is ideal for developers who are already familiar with Docker or similar container technologies and are eager to dive into Kubernetes.

specialDays.name: DevSecOps Day
specialDays.details: Fortify Your Digital Business In today’s rapidly evolving digital landscape, security is paramount. The DevSecOps Day is designed to provide software developers and architects, infrastructure and cloud engineers, as well as IT leaders and strategists with the knowledge and tools needed to effectively address the most pressing security challenges.

specialDays.name: Platform Engineering Day
specialDays.details: Unlock the potential of internal developer platforms to transform your organization’s software development, deployment and API ecosystem. During this thematic conference day we will explore the intersection of platform engineering and API-first strategies, emphasizing developer portals, API discovery, versioning, and governance as essential enablers for agile, scalable development environments.Through technical insights and practical case studies, we’ll examine how API management and developer portals streamline workflows, empower self-service, and enhance collaboration. Geared towards a technical and strategic audience,insights into developer-centric internal platforms with DevOps, DevSecOps, and API-first principles will be provided. Giving attendees strategies for seamless API lifecycle management and cross-team integration.

conference.name: DevOpsCon London 2025
conference.locationName: Park Plaza Victoria London, 239 Vauxhall Bridge Rd, Pimlico, London SW1V 1EQ, Vereinigtes Königreich
